meanings.definition: To crown or invest with regal power
meanings.sent1: The king was coronating his son as the new prince.
meanings.sent2: The queen will be coronating the winner of the royal tournament.
meanings.sent3: The royal jester joked about coronating the court jester as the 'funniest fool'.
meanings.sent4: The sun coronating the mountain with its golden rays was a majestic sight.
meanings.sent5: The act of coronating symbolizes the transfer of power and authority.

meanings.definition: To inaugurate or install in office
meanings.sent1: The president will be coronating the new prime minister next week.
meanings.sent2: The CEO is coronating the new vice president of the company.
meanings.sent3: The office staff joked about coronating the new intern as the 'coffee king'.
meanings.sent4: The key to success is coronating the right person in the leadership role.
meanings.sent5: Coronating a new leader brings hope and anticipation for the future.

meanings.definition: To honor or reward with a crown or garland
meanings.sent1: The festival organizers will be coronating the best dancer with a special prize.
meanings.sent2: The competition will coronate the champion with a golden wreath.
meanings.sent3: The community decided to coronate the kindest citizen as the 'neighborhood hero'.
meanings.sent4: Her talent in singing coronated her as the queen of the music industry.
meanings.sent5: Coronating excellence inspires others to strive for greatness.
